Package depgraph.Parser

Class Parser

java.lang.Object
depgraph.Parser.Parser
public class Parser
extends java.lang.Object
The Parser is the core of the C Dependency Graph project. This class creates an object-oriented representation of the graphs and the nodes and edges within so that they can be changed and reformatted into a module based dependency view. Each input graph is handled one at a time and parsed line by line until the end of the file is reached. The Parser uses the Lexer to determine what kind of declaration (e.g. node_stmt, edge_stmt, attr_list, etc.) is on the current line in the graph being processed. Based on that, the Parser will know how to interpret the information returned from the Lexer's tokenizer function.

    Logger used with levels SEVERE, WARNING, INFO, and FINE.

    Collection of Module objects created based on the module prefixes parsed when the nodes are created.
    private java.util.ArrayList<Node> nodes
    Collection of Node objects created based on the contents of the DOT file(s) passed to the program.

  • Method Details

    • parse

      public void parse​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> fileContents)
      Kick off point for parsing, used by Manager. Parses every individual file handed to the program into nodes and edges, then separates those nodes into modules based on the parsed module prefix.
      Parameters:
      fileContents - File contents created by the Reader. In List form, each String contains the contents of one file.

    • parse

      private void parse​(java.lang.String fileContents)
      Handles a single file's contents. Passes each line of the file to the Lexer so it can be tokenized to ease handling. At the moment, this function ignores L_BRACE, R_BRACE, NODE_ATTR_STMT, EDGE_ATTR_STMT, IGNORED, and NONE because they have no real use in the information we are storing. When an edge is found, setting the Edge object's Node attributes may not be possible if a node hasn't been parsed yet. We attempt by calling the getNodeObjectFromId method, which searches for a Node object with a matching nodeId. If there is not yet an object with a matching nodeId, then it will throw a NPE, which is caught and effectively ignored. We try again after we've finished parsing all of the lines in the file.
      Parameters:
      fileContents - A string containing the contents of a single DOT file

    • cleanUpEdgeCollection

      private java.util.ArrayList<Edge> cleanUpEdgeCollection​(java.util.ArrayList<Edge> oldCollection)
      Takes a collection of Edges. If the source or destination Node in an Edge exists in the global context, it substitutes that for what was previously stored in the Edge. This aids in keeping nodes unique in the global context.
      Parameters:
      oldCollection - The list of Edges before updating their Nodes
      Returns:
      newCollection The list of Edges after updating their Nodes

    • existsInEdgeList

      private boolean existsInEdgeList​(Node src, Node dst)

    • getGlobalNodeFromNodeLabel

      private Node getGlobalNodeFromNodeLabel​(java.lang.String nodeLabel)
      Returns the global Node object that corresponds to a given node label
      Parameters:
      nodeLabel - The label of the Node to search for
      Returns:
      a Node that exists globally with the given label

    • cleanUpNodeCollection

      private java.util.ArrayList<Node> cleanUpNodeCollection​(java.util.ArrayList<Node> oldCollection)
      Removes nodes in a collection that are already accounted for in the global context
      Parameters:
      oldCollection - The list of Nodes before updating
      Returns:
      newCollection The list of Nodes after updating

    • getNodeIdFromString

      private java.lang.String getNodeIdFromString​(java.lang.String valueString)
      Determines the node_id from a node_stmt.
      Parameters:
      valueString - The value of a Lexer created Token which has a TokenType of node_stmt
      Returns:
      node_id as defined in the official DOT language grammar

    • getNodeLabelFromString

      private java.lang.String getNodeLabelFromString​(java.lang.String valueString)
      Determines the label of a node from the attribute list (will always be the first attribute in a node_stmt).
      Parameters:
      valueString - Either an attribute list, or the entire node_stmt line
      Returns:
      Label of the function

    • getModulePrefixFromNodeLabel

      private java.lang.String getModulePrefixFromNodeLabel​(java.lang.String nodeLabel)
      Determines the module prefix of a function from the node label.
      Parameters:
      nodeLabel - Label of the node (easiest to use the getNodeLabelFromString function first and pass the result here).
      Returns:
      Module prefix of a function (e.g. BAL, BMS, CONT, etc.)

    • getIsPublicFromNodeLabel

      private java.lang.Boolean getIsPublicFromNodeLabel​(java.lang.String nodeLabel)
      Determines if a function is public or private based on the function name's capitalization. If there is no module prefix (no '_' char) then it is an RTOS function and therefore public.
      Parameters:
      nodeLabel - the label of the node, in the form MOD_FunctionName
      Returns:
      True if the function is public, False if private, based on capitalization of the function name in nodeLabel

    • getSourceNodeIdFromString

      private java.lang.String getSourceNodeIdFromString​(java.lang.String valueString)
      Determines source node from an edge_stmt. edge_stmts always take the form src -> dest (whitespace is omitted by the Lexer).
      Parameters:
      valueString - The value of a Lexer created Token which has a TokenType of edge_stmt
      Returns:
      node_id of the source node in the edge_stmt

    • getDestinationNodeIdFromString

      private java.lang.String getDestinationNodeIdFromString​(java.lang.String valueString)
      Determines the destination node from an edge_stmt. edge_stmts always take the form src -> dest (whitespace omitted by the Lexer).
      Parameters:
      valueString - The value of a Lexer created Token which has a TokenType of edge_stmt
      Returns:
      node_id of the destination node in the edge_stmt

    • getNodeObjectFromId

      private Node getNodeObjectFromId​(java.util.ArrayList<Node> nodeCollection, java.lang.String nodeId) throws java.lang.NullPointerException
      Simple search function to find a node that matches a specific ID (nodeId) in a list. Both the list and ID need to passed to this function, however, it works for both source and destination nodes.
      Parameters:
      nodeCollection - ArrayList of nodes to search through.
      nodeId - Specific ID to match.
      Returns:
      The node with a matching ID.
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException - If a node with a matching ID cannot be found, then a NullPointerException is thrown.

    • existsInNodeList

      private boolean existsInNodeList​(java.lang.String nodeLabel)
      Helper function to scan the "global" list of nodes and check if there is a duplicate of the given node label.
      Parameters:
      nodeLabel - The node label (aka function name) to check against.
      Returns:
      true if there is a match, false otherwise.

    • getModuleFromModulePrefix

      private Module getModuleFromModulePrefix​(java.lang.String modulePrefix)
      Scans the "global" list of modules to find a Module object matching with a matching module prefix.
      Parameters:
      modulePrefix - Specific module prefix to search for (e.g. ADC, BAL, etc.).
      Returns:
      Module object with the matching module prefix, null if one doesn't exist.

    • getNodes

      public java.util.ArrayList<Node> getNodes()

    • getEdges

      public java.util.ArrayList<Edge> getEdges()

    • getModules

      public java.util.ArrayList<Module> getModules()
